quiz.title: CS101 Midterm Quiz - Computer Science Fundamentals
quiz.description: This quiz covers fundamental concepts in computer science including basic programming concepts, computer architecture, and problem-solving approaches.

questions.question_text: What is the primary function of an operating system?

answers.answer_text: To manage computer hardware and software resources

questions.question_text: Which data structure follows the Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) principle?

What is an eigenvalue?

A scalar by which an eigenvector is scaled during transformation

quiz.title: HIST301 European Social and Political Movements Quiz
quiz.description: Advanced quiz covering complex social movements, political ideologies, and historical interpretations of 19th-20th century European history.

questions.question_text: What was the primary purpose of the 'Principle of Legitimacy' advocated by Metternich at the Congress of Vienna (1815)?

answers.answer_text: To restore the ruling families deposed during the Napoleonic Wars
To establish democratic republics across Europe
To promote free trade agreements among European nations
To create a permanent pan-European military force

questions.question_text: Which factor was MOST significant in causing the revolutions of 1848 across Europe?

answers.answer_text: Religious conflicts between Catholics and Protestants

questions.question_text: The 'Dreyfus Affair' in late 19th-century France was historically significant primarily because it:

answers.answer_text: Exposed the deep divisions in French society between republicans/anti-clericals and monarchists/nationalists
Directly led to the collapse of the French Third Republic
Proved the superiority of military courts over civil courts
Caused France to abandon its vast colonial empire

questions.question_text: The concept of 'total war' as exemplified in World War I fundamentally changed European society by:

answers.answer_text: Only affecting military personnel and leaving civilian life unchanged
Mobilizing entire populations and economies for the war effort
Reducing the role of technology in combat

questions.question_text: Which statement most accurately describes the 'Non-Intervention' policy adopted by Britain and France during the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939)?

answers.answer_text: An official policy forbidding foreign involvement that was largely ineffective, as Germany and Italy aided the Nationalists while the Soviet Union aided the Republicans
A successful naval blockade that prevented any foreign powers from influencing the war
An alliance with the United States to jointly support the Spanish Republican government
A direct military intervention aimed at creating a neutral buffer zone

questions.question_text: Which statement best explains the paradox of European imperialism in the late 19th century?

answers.answer_text: European powers promoted democracy abroad while restricting it at home
Europeans justified colonial expansion using liberal ideals while practicing authoritarian rule over colonies
Colonial wealth had no impact on European domestic politics

questions.question_text: The primary economic goal of the Treaty of Rome (1957), which established the European Economic Community (EEC), was to:

answers.answer_text: Establish a common market and customs union among the six founding members
Immediately create a single European currency
Form a military alliance to counter the Warsaw Pact
Nationalize key industries within the member states

quiz.title: PHIL201 Advanced Logical Reasoning and Argumentation Quiz
quiz.description: Challenging quiz testing advanced logical reasoning, argument analysis, fallacy identification, and philosophical problem-solving skills.

questions.question_text: Consider this argument: 'All effective leaders are good communicators. Sarah is not a good communicator. Therefore, Sarah is not an effective leader.' This argument is:
According to Immanuel Kant's 'Formula of Humanity' (an expression of the Categorical Imperative), one must:

answers.answer_text: Always treat humanity, whether in oneself or in others, as an end and never merely as a means
Act only according to that maxim whereby you can at the same time will that it should become a universal law
Act so as to bring about the greatest good for the greatest number
Follow the divine commands as revealed through scripture

questions.question_text: Identify the logical fallacy in this argument: 'Climate scientists have been wrong about predictions before. Al Gore said polar ice would be gone by 2014. Therefore, we shouldn't trust current climate change predictions.'
John Searle's 'Chinese Room' thought experiment is designed to challenge which of the following claims?

answers.answer_text: That a computer running a program can have genuine understanding or consciousness (Strong AI)
That the mind is identical to the brain (Identity Theory)
That mental states are an illusion (Eliminative Materialism)
That the mind and body are two separate substances (Dualism)

questions.question_text: Which principle best explains why correlation does not imply causation?

answers.answer_text: Two variables can be correlated due to a third confounding variable
Correlation is always weaker than causation
Causation requires more data points than correlation

questions.question_text: In John Rawls' 'A Theory of Justice,' the 'veil of ignorance' is a thought experiment tool used to ensure that principles of justice are chosen from a position of:

answers.answer_text: Impartiality, by depriving individuals of knowledge about their own social status, talents, and conception of the good
Historical precedent, by examining successful societal models from the past
Divine revelation, by consulting sacred texts for guidance
Utilitarian calculation, by maximizing the average happiness of the group

questions.question_text: In formal logic, which of the following represents a valid inference pattern?

answers.answer_text: If P then Q. Q is true. Therefore P is true. (Affirming the consequent)
If P then Q. P is false. Therefore Q is false. (Denying the antecedent)
If P then Q. Q is false. Therefore P is false. (Modus tollens)
P or Q. P is true. Therefore Q is false. (False disjunctive inference)
